result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R. White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------------

To complete a total of forty (40) hours of community service work, which was completed up front.
----------------------------

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin R. White in court with attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Stop

Defendant Benjamin R. White in court with attorney Kevin T. Noonan.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 11-30-15. Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Benjamin R. White in court with attorney Kevin T. Noonan.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Motion deadline 11-23-15. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Transcript of Preliminary Hearing before the Hon. Phillip A. Koss on September 8, 2015
Court Reporter:  Janet L. Schulz
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Appearances made. Defendant appears in person with attorney Kevin T. Noonan. Andrew Hermann appears for the State of Wisconsin. State calls first witness Nicholas Lorenzen under direct examination of ADA Herrmann. States Exhibit #1 previously marked identified as Criminal Complaint. 
3:37 pm  Cross exam by Atty Noonan. 
3:43 pm  Objection by ADA Herrmann. Objection sustained. Cross exam by Atty Noonan continues. Objection by ADA Herrmann. 
3:45 pm  Redirect by ADA Herrmann. 
3:46 pm  Court finds probable cause has been found and matter bound over for trial.
Matter set over for Arraignment on 9-18-2015 at 1:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin R. White in court with attorney Kevin T. Noonan.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant Benjamin R. White appeared, Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant in court. Atty McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
